result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy Earl Whitehorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy Earl Whitehorn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve  10 months in the House of Correction with credit for  Zero  days served; Huber privileges for employment and child care with verification.  Sentence to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on March 14, 2016.   
-  Court sets Restitution at $0  (zero)
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by September 7, 2017  (09-07-2017).  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

Appeal rights given.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Troy Earl Whitehorn in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY   and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Troy Earl Whitehorn in court with Michelle Cahoon, student intern under the supervision of Francisco Araiza for attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Ron Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
